him, watched every movement, word, or look of his, never taking their blissfully adoring eyes off him. His broth- er and sisters struggled for the places nearest to him and disputed with one another who should bring him his tea, handkerchief, and pipe. 
Rost6v was very happy in the love they showed him; but the first moment of meeting had been so beatific that his present joy seemed insufficient, and he kept expecting something more, more and yet more.
